str2: The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sleep, be sleeping. From kata and heudo; to lie down to rest, i.e. to fall asleep.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Seed for sowing. From speiro; a scattering, i.e. seed.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Intrans: I sprout; trans: I cause to sprout, make to grow up. From blastos; to germinate; by implication, to yield fruit.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lengthen, extend, grow. From mekos; to lengthen, i.e. to enlarge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
